we had a large-scale problem to solve

large in terms of the number of brands
that we supported which was over a dozen
and the number of countries and
languages I think we're in 35 countries
and 18 different languages so it was
this huge breadth and we had basically
cloned all these different code bases
and changed them up a little bit and
change the design so everything was
slightly different the prospect of hey
we're vice we want to add a new vertical
could have met reinventing the wheel
every time so the idea of like we'd like
to add a whole new vertical with all new
types of content oh and by the way we'd
like to have ad targeting options and
all these like local local options that
would have met building the entire stack
just for that one vertical we have sites
in 35 different countries in languages
that read from left to right in
languages that have characters and so we
wanted to make sure that this experience
worked well for everyone if we were
going to scale either our video
offerings on on the web or our
advertising opportunities on the web it
was just not possible to like say let's
add a video control where it's gonna be
displayed put ads in the video or take
an article and control its ad targeting
do that all in multiple CMS is in
multiple parts of the world without
unifying everything into a single
platform this tied very closely to the
Amazon s3 system which actually allowed
us to connect our build system with a
really simple way to programmatically
push new changes to assets for us to
actually just deploy something and flip
a switch went from being an ordeal where
there was a lot of manual work involved
on their terminal SS Aging into boxes
where now that process became a very
simple you know just pushed to a
we'll get Branch a protected git branch
let the Travis CI system just take over
and suddenly within minutes you had the
code everywhere in one you know at once
there is better in terms of measurable
things in terms of the speed at which we
can design and evolve and ship things
which is so different than before where
we would spend months on a site now if
we wanted to build a new site we can
roll it out in a matter of weeks and
know that it's going to get all the same
features that every other site is going
to get at the same rapid clip so I think
that is better
